description: Sets user pool multi-factor authentication (MFA) and passkey configuration. For more information about user pool MFA, see Adding MFA. For more information about WebAuthn passkeys see Authentication flows.

parameters.name: SmsMfaConfiguration
parameters.description: Configures user pool SMS messages for MFA. Sets the message template and the SMS message sending configuration for Amazon SNS. SmsAuthenticationMessage (string) --- The SMS authentication message that will be sent to users with the code they must sign in with. The message must contain the {####} placeholder. Your user pool replaces the placeholder with the MFA code. If this parameter isn't provided, your user pool sends a default message. SmsConfiguration (dict) --- User pool configuration for delivery of SMS messages with Amazon Simple Notification Service. To send SMS messages with Amazon SNS in the Amazon Web Services Region that you want, the Amazon Cognito user pool uses an Identity and Access Management (IAM) role in your Amazon Web Services account. You can set SmsConfiguration in CreateUserPool and UpdateUserPool, or in SetUserPoolMfaConfig. The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon SNS caller. This is the ARN of the IAM role in your Amazon Web Services account that Amazon Cognito will use to send SMS messages. SMS messages are subject to a spending limit. ExternalId (string) --- The external ID provides additional security for your IAM role. You can use an ExternalId with the IAM role that you use with Amazon SNS to send SMS messages for your user pool. If you provide an ExternalId, your Amazon Cognito user pool includes it in the request to assume your IAM role. You can configure the role trust policy to require that Amazon Cognito, and any principal, provide the ExternalID. If you use the Amazon Cognito Management Console to create a role for SMS multi-factor authentication (MFA), Amazon Cognito creates a role with the required permissions and a trust policy that demonstrates use of the ExternalId. For more information about the ExternalId of a role, see How to use an external ID when granting access to your Amazon Web Services resources to a third party. SnsRegion (string) --- The Amazon Web Services Region to use with Amazon SNS integration. You can choose the same Region as your user pool, or a supported Legacy Amazon SNS alternate Region. Amazon Cognito resources in the Asia Pacific (Seoul) Amazon Web Services Region must use your Amazon SNS configuration in the Asia Pacific (Tokyo) Region. For more information, see SMS message settings for Amazon Cognito user pools.

nested_params.name: SmsAuthenticationMessage
nested_params.description: The SMS authentication message that will be sent to users with the code they must sign in with. The message must contain the {####} placeholder. Your user pool replaces the placeholder with the MFA code. If this parameter isn't provided, your user pool sends a default message.

nested_params.name: SmsConfiguration
nested_params.description: User pool configuration for delivery of SMS messages with Amazon Simple Notification Service. To send SMS messages with Amazon SNS in the Amazon Web Services Region that you want, the Amazon Cognito user pool uses an Identity and Access Management (IAM) role in your Amazon Web Services account. You can set SmsConfiguration in CreateUserPool and UpdateUserPool, or in SetUserPoolMfaConfig.

nested_params.name: SnsCallerArn
nested_params.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon SNS caller. This is the ARN of the IAM role in your Amazon Web Services account that Amazon Cognito will use to send SMS messages. SMS messages are subject to a spending limit.

nested_params.name: ExternalId
nested_params.description: The external ID provides additional security for your IAM role. You can use an ExternalId with the IAM role that you use with Amazon SNS to send SMS messages for your user pool. If you provide an ExternalId, your Amazon Cognito user pool includes it in the request to assume your IAM role. You can configure the role trust policy to require that Amazon Cognito, and any principal, provide the ExternalID. If you use the Amazon Cognito Management Console to create a role for SMS multi-factor authentication (MFA), Amazon Cognito creates a role with the required permissions and a trust policy that demonstrates use of the ExternalId. For more information about the ExternalId of a role, see How to use an external ID when granting access to your Amazon Web Services resources to a third party.

nested_params.name: SnsRegion
nested_params.description: Amazon Cognito resources in the Asia Pacific (Seoul) Amazon Web Services Region must use your Amazon SNS configuration in the Asia Pacific (Tokyo) Region. For more information, see SMS message settings for Amazon Cognito user pools.

parameters.name: SoftwareTokenMfaConfiguration
parameters.description: Configures a user pool for time-based one-time password (TOTP) MFA. Enables or disables TOTP. Enabled (boolean) --- The activation state of TOTP MFA.

nested_params.name: Enabled
nested_params.description: The activation state of TOTP MFA.

parameters.name: EmailMfaConfiguration
parameters.description: Sets configuration for user pool email message MFA and sign-in with one-time passwords (OTPs). Includes the subject and body of the email message template for sign-in and MFA messages. To activate this setting, your user pool must be in the Essentials tier or higher. Message (string) --- The template for the email messages that your user pool sends to users with codes for MFA and sign-in with email OTPs. The message must contain the {####} placeholder. In the message, Amazon Cognito replaces this placeholder with the code. If you don't provide this parameter, Amazon Cognito sends messages in the default format. Subject (string) --- The subject of the email messages that your user pool sends to users with codes for MFA and email OTP sign-in.

nested_params.name: Message
nested_params.description: The template for the email messages that your user pool sends to users with codes for MFA and sign-in with email OTPs. The message must contain the {####} placeholder. In the message, Amazon Cognito replaces this placeholder with the code. If you don't provide this parameter, Amazon Cognito sends messages in the default format.

nested_params.name: Subject
nested_params.description: The subject of the email messages that your user pool sends to users with codes for MFA and email OTP sign-in.

parameters.name: MfaConfiguration
parameters.description: Sets multi-factor authentication (MFA) to be on, off, or optional. When ON, all users must set up MFA before they can sign in. When OPTIONAL, your application must make a client-side determination of whether a user wants to register an MFA device. For user pools with adaptive authentication with threat protection, choose OPTIONAL. When MfaConfiguration is OPTIONAL, managed login doesn't automatically prompt users to set up MFA. Amazon Cognito generates MFA prompts in API responses and in managed login for users who have chosen and configured a preferred MFA factor.

parameters.name: WebAuthnConfiguration
parameters.description: The configuration of your user pool for passkey, or WebAuthn, authentication and registration. You can set this configuration independent of the MFA configuration options in this operation. RelyingPartyId (string) --- Sets or displays the authentication domain, typically your user pool domain, that passkey providers must use as a relying party (RP) in their configuration. Under the following conditions, the passkey relying party ID must be the fully-qualified domain name of your custom domain: The user pool is configured for passkey authentication. The user pool has a custom domain, whether or not it also has a prefix domain. Your application performs authentication with managed login or the classic hosted UI. UserVerification (string) --- When required, users can only register and sign in users with passkeys that are capable of user verification. When preferred, your user pool doesn't require the use of authenticators with user verification but encourages it.

nested_params.name: RelyingPartyId
nested_params.description: Sets or displays the authentication domain, typically your user pool domain, that passkey providers must use as a relying party (RP) in their configuration. Under the following conditions, the passkey relying party ID must be the fully-qualified domain name of your custom domain:

nested_params.name: UserVerification
nested_params.description: When required, users can only register and sign in users with passkeys that are capable of user verification. When preferred, your user pool doesn't require the use of authenticators with user verification but encourages it.

nested_items.name: SmsMfaConfiguration
nested_items.description: Shows user pool SMS message configuration for MFA and sign-in with SMS-message OTPs. Includes the message template and the SMS message sending configuration for Amazon SNS.

nested_items.name: SmsAuthenticationMessage
nested_items.description: The SMS authentication message that will be sent to users with the code they must sign in with. The message must contain the {####} placeholder. Your user pool replaces the placeholder with the MFA code. If this parameter isn't provided, your user pool sends a default message.

nested_items.name: SmsConfiguration
nested_items.description: User pool configuration for delivery of SMS messages with Amazon Simple Notification Service. To send SMS messages with Amazon SNS in the Amazon Web Services Region that you want, the Amazon Cognito user pool uses an Identity and Access Management (IAM) role in your Amazon Web Services account.

nested_items.name: SnsCallerArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon SNS caller. This is the ARN of the IAM role in your Amazon Web Services account that Amazon Cognito will use to send SMS messages. SMS messages are subject to a spending limit.

nested_items.name: ExternalId
nested_items.description: The external ID provides additional security for your IAM role. You can use an ExternalId with the IAM role that you use with Amazon SNS to send SMS messages for your user pool. If you provide an ExternalId, your Amazon Cognito user pool includes it in the request to assume your IAM role. You can configure the role trust policy to require that Amazon Cognito, and any principal, provide the ExternalID. If you use the Amazon Cognito Management Console to create a role for SMS multi-factor authentication (MFA), Amazon Cognito creates a role with the required permissions and a trust policy that demonstrates use of the ExternalId.

nested_items.name: SnsRegion
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services Region to use with Amazon SNS integration. You can choose the same Region as your user pool, or a supported Legacy Amazon SNS alternate Region.

nested_items.name: SoftwareTokenMfaConfiguration
nested_items.description: Shows user pool configuration for time-based one-time password (TOTP) MFA. Includes TOTP enabled or disabled state.

nested_items.name: Enabled
nested_items.description: The activation state of TOTP MFA.

nested_items.name: EmailMfaConfiguration
nested_items.description: Shows configuration for user pool email message MFA and sign-in with one-time passwords (OTPs). Includes the subject and body of the email message template for sign-in and MFA messages. To activate this setting, your user pool must be in the Essentials tier or higher.

nested_items.name: Message
nested_items.description: The template for the email messages that your user pool sends to users with codes for MFA and sign-in with email OTPs. The message must contain the {####} placeholder. In the message, Amazon Cognito replaces this placeholder with the code. If you don't provide this parameter, Amazon Cognito sends messages in the default format.

nested_items.name: Subject
nested_items.description: The subject of the email messages that your user pool sends to users with codes for MFA and email OTP sign-in.

nested_items.name: MfaConfiguration
nested_items.description: Displays multi-factor authentication (MFA) as on, off, or optional. When ON, all users must set up MFA before they can sign in. When OPTIONAL, your application must make a client-side determination of whether a user wants to register an MFA device. For user pools with adaptive authentication with threat protection, choose OPTIONAL.

nested_items.name: WebAuthnConfiguration
nested_items.description: The configuration of your user pool for passkey, or WebAuthn, sign-in with authenticators like biometric and security-key devices. Includes relying-party configuration and settings for user-verification requirements.

nested_items.name: RelyingPartyId
nested_items.description: Sets or displays the authentication domain, typically your user pool domain, that passkey providers must use as a relying party (RP) in their configuration.
The user pool is configured for passkey authentication.
The user pool has a custom domain, whether or not it also has a prefix domain.
Your application performs authentication with managed login or the classic hosted UI.

nested_items.name: UserVerification
nested_items.description: When required, users can only register and sign in users with passkeys that are capable of user verification. When preferred, your user pool doesn't require the use of authenticators with user verification but encourages it.
